theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genetic Program and Phenoptosis-Based Aging Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: This theory emphasizes a genetic biochemical program controlling longevity with components modulating damage and response, fitting the theme of genetically programmed organismal death and phenoptosis.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genetic Program and Phenoptosis-Based Aging Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on programmed senescence as an evolved biological mechanism with population-level benefits, aligning with phenoptosis and genetic programming of aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genetic Program and Phenoptosis-Based Aging Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes genetically controlled aging mechanisms including telomere regulation and phenoptosis, fitting the genetic program and programmed death theme.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genetic Program and Phenoptosis-Based Aging Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Proposes aging as a genetically programmed sequence with systematic gene shutdown, consistent with genetic programming and phenoptosis concepts.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genetic Program and Phenoptosis-Based Aging Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Posits genetically programmed lifespan limitation with evolutionary group benefits, fitting the genetic program and phenoptosis cluster.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genetic Program and Phenoptosis-Based Aging Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on phenoptosis as programmed altruistic death benefiting kin and population, clearly within genetic program and phenoptosis mechanisms.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genetic Program and Phenoptosis-Based Aging Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Defines phenoptosis as genetically programmed organismal death mediated by mitochondrial ROS, fitting genetic program and phenoptosis mechanisms.

theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes phenoptosis in arthropods as genetically encoded programmed death for population regulation, fitting this subcluster.

theory_assignments.reasoning: Posits genetic pathways actively accelerating aging as an evolved program, consistent with genetic program and phenoptosis concepts.

theory_assignments.reasoning: Details mitochondrial ROS-mediated programmed aging as chronic and acute phenoptosis, fitting genetic program and phenoptosis mechanisms.

theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes programmed internal lifespan limitation for population evolvability, consistent with genetic program and phenoptosis cluster.

theory_assignments.reasoning: Proposes genetic program for aging and death (phenoptosis) with epigenetic regulation, fitting this subcluster.

theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes senescence as evolved programmed process with selective advantages and programmed death in semelparous species, fitting this cluster.

theory_assignments.reasoning: Posits adaptive lifespan limitation via evolved mechanisms with group benefits, consistent with genetic program and phenoptosis concepts.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: IGF-1/Insulin Signaling and DNA Repair Programmed Aging Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on IGF-1 deficiency impairing DNA damage response and repair, linking insulin signaling to programmed aging mechanisms.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: IGF-1/Insulin Signaling and DNA Repair Programmed Aging Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes deregulation of nutrient sensing pathways including insulin/IGF signaling affecting aging, fitting this signaling and repair theme.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: IGF-1/Insulin Signaling and DNA Repair Programmed Aging Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links dietary restriction effects on aging to altered fuel use and insulin signaling, consistent with nutrient sensing and DNA repair mechanisms.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: IGF-1/Insulin Signaling and DNA Repair Programmed Aging Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes genetic regulation of aging via daf genes and insulin/IGF-1 signaling pathway in C. elegans, fitting this subcluster.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Telomere and Cellular Replicative Limit Programmed Aging Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on genetic programming of aging including cellular replicative limits (Hayflick limit) and activation of aging-specific genes, fitting telomere and replicative limit mechanisms.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Telomere and Cellular Replicative Limit Programmed Aging Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes programmed senescence and aging in plants regulated by genetic and epigenetic developmental programs, analogous to replicative limits.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Telomere and Cellular Replicative Limit Programmed Aging Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details genetically determined life program in blowflies with hormonal control linking reproduction and aging, fitting developmental genetic programming.
